I just have to comment.  So everyone has to be so careful not to touch the porcelain steel sheet because it's pressure sensitive. Now lets go back to the beginning.  It first comes in a tight roll that goes through a rolling press to straighten it before shearing it into sections.  Then it goes through another rolling press to get all the air pockets out after being glued to the backer board.  Then, in a stack of 50, goes into another press until the glue sets.  All of this and apparently it's so sensitive that finger pressure will ruin it?  Thank you for letting me get that off my chest.
